text: schokoladenbraun mit beigem Schaum. Geruch Nelke, etwas Banane, malzig. Geschmack malzig süß mit Aromen von Nelke und nur wenig Banane. Dazu leichte Röst-und Schokoladenaromen. Sehr runde Sache!

Chessnut brown colour with light beige head. Aroma is yeast and bready. Taste fruity soft weisse. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dark red-brown colour with lasting head. Aroma has light yeast, banana and caramel. Flavour has caramel and a little cocoa bittersweetness.

500 ml from tap at Andechser in Mering close to Augsburg. Served in Weizenbier glass. Darkbrown colour, creamy foam head. Caramel, cocoa, chocolate, a bit coffee, malt. Malty, with slight bitter hint. Soft carbonated, but a bit watery. Medium body, oily texure.
Draught at Rose and Crown in Palo Alto. This batch really lacked the malty richness I was hoping for. Also, the esters were restrained. Not too interesting.

Bottle. Dark brown. Big thick head. Aroma of bananas and malts. Taste is bananas, yeast, malts, bread, a little bit of chocolate and caramell. Rather bitter than sweet compared to other Hefeweizen. Strong carbonation. Slightly alcoholic. Full bodied and süffig. Lovely.

Sampled from a 16.9 oz brown bottle this beer poured a very dark brown color with orange highlights and an enormous foamy orange-white head that lingered and left good lacing. The aroma was bread crust, pretzel, cola and hints of cherry and fig. The flavor was bitter and somewhat astringent with notes of toffee, yeast, cola and raisin. Medium length finish. Medium body. Ok.

Rated on 11-21-2016 (Bottle) The appearance is a large beige moderately fizzy head that mostly diminished, transparent orange brown body, slow rising carbonation, and a fair amount of lacing. The aroma presents wheat, toffee, dark malt, caramel, light banana, and spicy. The flavor is wheat, dark malt, spicy, some toffee, lightly sweet, light banana, and a dry finish. The mouthfeel of this beer is watery and light carbonation. This beer is medium bodied. A very drinkable beer with a decent taste to it. This is a beer that I would partake in again.

Bottle. And Draft. Dark brown in colour. Malty; wheaty malts, light roast, chocolate, coffee, caramel/toffee. Yeasty and Spicy. Fruity: banana, lemon notes. Hoppy; slight hops. Smooth. Sweet malty with mildly fruity sourness. Easy drinking. Likeable. Decent. (2008)
Hefetrübes, sehr dunkles braun mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, etwas Karamell, fruchtig, überreife Bananen, Nüsse, spritzig.
Bottle from Ambrosetti - Dark brown color with nice slightly beige head. Taste is dark malts, chocolate, toffee, yeast. Medium sweet, body could be fuller and smoother. Nice fresh Dunkelweizen.

4. 12. 2016, Ljubljana. Bottled. As a fan of wheat beer, this one was softbodied with big head, but less taste and aroma than expected.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Dense off white head. Aroma is caramel and banana. Tastes full bodied.nice dunkel. Medium bitterness. Warming.

Pours a medium dark brown with various levels of dark brown yeast solids, depending on the lot. Been drinking this for 2 years since it became available in bottles in PA. Aroma is banana, with some earthy woodiness. Taste is mild ripe banana with a tart nutty finish. The walnut finish is what makes this version unique. It may be somewhat watery for American palates, but for me this is what a beer should be.

0,5 l bottle. Pours hazy reddish brown with big tan quickly dissipating head. Aroma of banana, clove and caramel and chocolate. Flavor is very ripe banana, bread, yeast, caramel, quite sweet with very lively carbonation, all of that on top of very subtle ham and earth feel. Like a light rauchbier. Sweet and light bitter finish. Pleasant and drinkable. Not soft enough for weissbier for my taste.

Bottle. This is a really nice beer. Hazy brown in color with a large three finger, light tan head. Aroma is fruity with notes of roasted grains. Taste is banana with very light chocolate and spice. Good stuff.

On tap at a nice steakhouse in Chicago. Aroma is mild roasted wheat. Flavor is sweet well balanced, wheatey, medium bodied. Very smooth. A touch of chocolate and fruit but not overbearing. An outstanding Dunkelweiss.

Bottle: &nbsp Dark ruby, thin to moderate frothy sandy head. &nbsp Not much lacing. &nbsp Soft clove on the nose, a bit bready, some minor dark pitted fruit. &nbsp Moderate body and mouthfeel. &nbsp Quick finish, a touch of clove but like its lighter cousin it doesnt have much in the way of banana or bubblegum. &nbsp A lighter German example, but still decent.
A nice appearance, this is far too wheaty for me. A lot of banana throughout, the sweetness and the wheat make it unenjoyable to my palate.
Brown pour with a tan head. A bit of fruit, spice, molasses, caramel toasted malt, and chocolate. Full bodied. A great, hearty German brew.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with a thick tan head. Aroma of wheat, caramel, clove and banana. Flavor was malty and sweet with caramel, banana, toffee, wheat, raisins and a hint of molasses.

Aroma: pleasant, bubblegum, banana, low phenolics, caramel, cocoa, wheat. 
Some low herbal bitterness present in taste, fluffy palate. 
Enjoyable medium body.

500 ml bottle. Served in a mug, the beer pours a slightly hazy reddish/brown color with about an inch and a half creamy tan head. The head stuck around for a while, and theres a decent amount of lacing. The brew smells like caramel, clove, bananas, and some chocolate. Taste is similar to the aroma, theres caramel malt, clove, banana, bready/grainy malt, toffee and dark fruitiness noticeable. Mouthfeel/body is medium, its a bit creamy and easy enough to drink. Theres also a good amount of carbonation. I thought it was an enjoyable enough brew, glad I tried this one!

500ml bottle from Beeratoria in Moscow. Pours cloudy brown with a large beige head - it was beautiful until I made the mistake of pouring out the chunks of yeast at the bottom. Aroma is chocolate, banana. Taste is cocoa, light roastiness, malt, banana.

UPDATED: SEP 19, 2016 On tap at Andechser am Dom. Aroma is a little bitter, little clove and a little fruity. Essentially a bad fruit cake. Pours dark brown with lots of head which lasts for ages with a few bubbles visible. Tart to start, then plenty of banana raisins and bread. Little bit spicy and a little bit tart to finish.

Bottle. Pours a deep, hazy red-brown with a high, creamy, mixed-grained, light brown head. Nose is a little muted because of the pillowy head, but has tea, caramel, smoke, cocoa, fruity, earthy, and meaty notes; its a very solid nose. On the tongue, it starts out caramel and chocolate, then swings in with tea, smoke, and bitterness; well balanced and integrated, without any of the odd sticking-out flavors of some dunkelweissen. Smooth, but strong enough to make you stand up and take notice. Finish is long, dry, and smoky. Note to all American brewers who try to brew a dunkelweiss; this is your target. Good luck.
Frisch vom Hahn in Meißen getrunken. Das erste und bisher einzigste Weizen, wo ich Röstaromen rausgeschmeckt habe.
UPDATED: JUN 17, 2017 Темный, кофейно- вкус с аромато& одиноче& и зеленог& луга

Bottle. Hazy dark brown color with thick light brown head. Aroma has malt, wheat, yeast and caramel. Taste is malty with quite long a bit sweet and bitter aftertaste. Flavors of dark fruits, raisins, bread and sweet malt.
$3.49 bottle from Wine Warehouse. Pours hazy deep brown with a soft beige head. Aroma is lightly smoked meat, caramel. Flavor is caramel, leaves, banana, nuts, light wood. Tasty.

Tap at Zum Schneider, Montauk. Pours dark Burgundy, chestnut. Off white head. Aroma is clove, wheat, caramel, fig, toffee. Flavor is caramel, toffee, wheat, light lemon. super creamy body. Nice actually. Thats a bit different than Im used to from German beer. Flavor is kinda light but the creaminess is reminiscent of nitro.
Delicious! Immediate nice thick head and when you sip the deep dark roasted barley/malt flavors arise. Smooth and delightful to sip on. Slightly burnt aftertaste but not a deal-ender!
Pours a color slightly lighter than cola. Very lively mouthfeel. Notes of brown, sugar, metal, banana, and roasted nuts.

May. 15. On tap at Andechser am Dom. This one poured hazy brown body with a huge, lightly off white head atop. Weaker, but really fine aroma, caramel, cocoa and weizen fruits beneath. Flavor was weak, too, although complex. Both lightly sweet and bitter, with range of toasted malt flavors along with wheat notes in the far background. Thin to medium body, moderately long chalky, yet more like sweet dunkel, toasted finish. Although subtle for the style it was quite good and a bit positively (maybe) atypical Dunkelweizen.

Bottle 50cl. Poured into a weizen glass. Hazy deep amber, huge frothy beige head, good retention and lacing; aroma wheat, toasted malts, banana, cloves, yeast; fresh taste, medium sweet and light bitter, wheaty, fruity, light toasted malts, some caramel; aftertaste mild and a bit watery, light fruity sweetbitter, spicy notes; medium body, watery texture, average carbonation; fresh and pleasant, very quaffable.

Pour is a dark brown with a large tan head. Aroma is a mix of dark bread with some cocoa powder. It also has some earthy dankness. Flavor is a decent chewy and nutty malt with a little banana and maybe a ever so slight vanilla. Again this beer is probably way better fresh at the source but I can see why this would be a top 50 dunkelweizen. A richer than usual malt makes this one special.

Dark brown with big soft light brown head. However some blocks of yeast swimming around in it (which i generally dont find attractive), hence one of the lowest appearance scores I ever gave. Aroma is very convincing: marzipan banana and caramel, a little cocoa if I#m not mistaken. Taste is much less: a little sweetness and a little bitterness. Due to the carbonation also a natural sourness. Expected a richer and deeper taste. Body is also only medium and the finish is rather short. Overall still very nice.
Draft at Churchkey. Clear bright amber brown color, bright light tan head. Aroma of creme brullee. Taste is sweet caramel. Very sweet stuff.

This seems like a good dunkelweizen, for what its worth. Light roast touch and some raw barley. Brown pour with ok head. Some banana bread. Light tangy and clean finish. Easy to drink but not much going on here. Bottle.

Draft at the freaking brewery (or restaurant really) in München. Cloudy dark brown or chestnut with a lasting light khaki head. Banana bomb! Aroma also has caramel and other ester notes. Great flavor, mild sweetness, lots of banana esters. Medium-light bodied, crisp, very drinkable. Strong offering for the style.
Deep brown color with a large head. Strong banana and wheat aroma. Flavor of ripe banana, caramel, molasses. Light fruit. Sweetish finish. Full body.

Flasche 0,5l: Kastanienbraun, kräftige Trübung, kräftiger feinporiger Schaum; in der Nase kräftige Süße, malzig, Malzzucker, Röstaromen, leicht nussig, dunkle Fruchtaromen, Kaffee; im Körper kräftige Röstaromen, würzig, Röstmalz, eher trocken, sehr cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, malzig, Hefearomen, leicht nussig, Kaffee; angenehmer trocken-würziger Nachgang

Bottle, Frankfurt Airport, meticulously poured by a friendly barmaid. Murky brown with thick offwhite head. Aroma has yeast and syrup. Sweetish flavour, more yeast and light syrupy notes. Slightly earthy with light roast. Not bad.

The beer pours chestnut brown with a dense tan head. The aroma has nuttiness, maple, smooth toasted wheat and is pretty rich. It has a medium rich body with a good amount of soft carbonation. The flavor starts like a drier version of the aroma with an interesting dry maple syrup flavor. The finish has a touch of woody spicy hops. Nice.

Bottle from Bacchanalia, Mill Road, Cambridge. Dark brown, with a lively tight cream-coloured head on top. Banana and chocolate malt in the scent. Sweet, malty taste. A bit of coconut on the surprisingly short finish. Body fairly thin. Not a bad drink, only the finish is a bit of a let down.

(Flasche) Es hat eine braune bis schwarze Farbe, ist trüb mit einer fast weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist hefig,  malzig, Honignote und retronasal eine Röstnote. Der Geschmack ist eher schlank, samtig, hefig, prickelnd und leicht röstig. Im Abgang erstärkt die Röstnote.

Pours a murky hazelnut brown color, with a medium sized, froth head.

Smells of unripe banana and earth covered cherries, together with a decent spiciness. Offers a subtle smokiness with more, riper banana. 

Has a higher carbonation with an utmost soft mouthfeel to it, due to the mellowing yeast pillow, building the foundation of this, together with a stony mineral quality to it.

Tastes of banana peel thrown onto forest earth, while offering smoked ham underneath, adding a unique twist to the earth. Together with an incredible smoothness, peppery spices and minerals become visible, resulting into an enjoyable refreshment. Finishes very clean, with earthy malts and a subtle sourness, providing a silk aqueous softness.

This is an easy drinker with a lot of strongheaded character to it. Never experienced smoked malts and banana in the same drink before, but it works out really well, with yeast balancing the taste throughout.

My first beer of 2016. bottled. This beer has a fantastic appearance. Dark brown, a khaki colored head, and an abundance of sediment floating in the beer, which might be unappealing to some drinkers. Strong aroma of banana and clove. More of these in the flavor, but here there is a mild roasted character as well. Surprisingly lively palate. Some chocolate. A fantastic beer, without a doubt one of the best dunkelweizens to be found anywhere.
Fad i klosteret Andechs. Farven er mørkebrun med en lysebrun skumkrone. Aromaen er banan, karamel og ristet malt. Smagen er malt, sirup og frugt.

Poured from 16.9 OZ bottle into a pint glass. This is an awesome dunkel. the appearance is a very reddish amber with a minimal white head. The aroma is all fruit and malt. The flavor is malt, spice and fruit and a real joy to drink.
Botella 50 cl tomada en el Lupulo en octubre 2011. Fcpref 13..04..2012. (r395). Cuerpo suave fácil de beber con 5 vol. Sabores y aromas maltosos y cereales. Normal.

Bottle. Dark brown body with light brown head. Aroma is fruity banana with some caramel and slightly roasted malts. Taste is nice malty with molasses and some fruits. Aftertaste is nice fruity malty with hints of bitterness. Nice one.

Pours a cloudy dark chestnut brown color with dark amber edges and a two finger, frothy off-white head that very slowly settles into a thick, lasting ring. Very good retention, taking a while to settle and leaving sporadic streaks of soapy lacing behind. 

Inviting aroma with a nice balance of zesty spice, bready yeast, light fruit, citrus and slightly roasted malt. Very peppery with a strong clove presence followed by sourdough bread, banana and bubblegum. Theres also a decent amount of citrus peel but its somewhat overshadowed by the darker malt bill. Subtle roast with sweeter caramel, toffee, hazelnut and biscuit character. Nice complexity in the nose with a decent roasted malt presence thats well integrated into the weisse bier elements. 

Medium body with soft carbonation and a strong peppery spice presence up front that lingers over the yeast, citrus and sweeter malt notes into a spritzy, tart finish. Hints of black pepper and clove dominate at first but are soon countered by some sourdough bread and banana before some citric acidity kicks in on the back end. The malt presence isnt as prominent as in the nose but its still evident with subtle roast and hints of toasted malt, hazelnut, caramel and toffee. Decent amount of sweetness without taking away from the classic wheat beer flavors. Slightly tart lemon juice/pith flavor toward the back of the palate. Crisp and refreshing and while its heavier than an average weissebier, its still pretty easy to drink.

pours a dark chestnut with a big steady beige head and a nice lacing. aroma of banana (no surprise here), kandis/rock candy, smoke, tea, black cherry, raisins, chocolate. flavour of bitter chocolate, nuts, spices. balanced slightly bitter finish.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2016 Bottle from Cork & Cask. Murky amber/brown body with a thin beige head. Light lacing. Aroma of bonfire, wood, honey and a hint of smoke. Flavour of caramelised apple, tea and banoffee pie. Medium body with a powdery, frothy texture. Soft fizz. Complex and very drinkable.

Dark brown colored, hazy, strong creamy beige head, lasting with nice lacing. Aroma is of wheat, toasted bread, cloves and spices, some banana. Taste is medium- sweet wheat, caramel, well toasted banana bread, bit nutty, light citric acidity, yeasty bready finish. Medium bodied, bit creamy, soft to average carbonation.

Flaske på Fastings Alle. Naturligvis uklar brun øl med stor skumkrone. Velduftende dunkelweizen med masser af frugtig hvede og et mildt strejf ristet malt . Forholdsvis sød dunkelweizen med en del banan. Kalkagtig og skummende fyldig i munden. Ok.

Dark brown color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of bread, caramel, chocolate, light banana. Taste of roast, light banana, cocoa, bread, and a semi-sweet finish.

From the bottle, pours Mahagoni with thick off white head. Nose is rosted malt and yeast some sour notes. Taste is roasted malts, sour yeast. High carbonation some floral hints there too. Grassy finish... Good dunkelweizen...

500 ml bottle. Pours dark brown with a foamy soapy khaki head that lasts. Aroma has bitterness roasted malts soft banana and light clove. Taste is clean slightly bitter with roasted malt some clove and banana esters. Palate is thin medium crisp fairly clean.

L:

Very Pleasant

On tap at Andechser Am Dom, Munchen. Hazy brown color, big offwhite to beige head, stable. Aroma of roasted malts, banana, cherries, strawberry. Fruity sweetish taste with proper bitter balance. Carbonated, medium body, spicy dry finish. Delicious dunkelweizen.

Aroma: caramel, cereal and grain malts, wheat, intense banana. Appearance: hazy, dark brown, huge, creamy, beige head. Taste: medium sweet. Palate: bubble gum, sweets continue, intense wheat, medium duration, average carbonation, light bitter finish. Overall: nice and well-balanced Dunkelweizen. Pint at GBBF 2015, Kensington Olympia.

Draught, cask at the GBBF 2015 (London Olympia) on 14-Aug-2015. Dark brown colour with a medium sized beige head. Medium to full body, and softly carbonated. Aroma of sweet malt and banana. Flavour of wheat, banana, malt, dark fruits and caramel. Sweet finish, with a chocolate toasted malt aftertaste that lingers.
Bottle. Aroma is malty, sweet. Taste is toffee, malty, sweet, nutty, light bitterness. Very tasty

Bottle in Munich. Dark brown body with medium, tan head. Nose is roasty, malty, wheat and bananas. Taste is also bananas, wheat, caramel and sweet candy. Finish floral, fruity with chocolate notes. Really interesting beer.
50cl bottle. Normaly Im not a big fan of dark weissbeer, but this one was a very, very pleasant surpise! Great taste! Defenitly a keeper, all year round!

Tight, beige head that starts more than four fingers thick. Recedes very slowly leaving a foam dome and plenty of stringy lace on the glass. Deep brown liquid. Appears to be quite clear in front of a bright light.

Smells like chalky chocolate milk. Light alcohol in the background. I get notes of black cherry, raw bread dough and raisin.

Mild, darker malt taste of toast and raw grains. The swallow has a hop presence, but the stronger flavor is of the wheat. Brief sour aftertaste. Thin bodied with a sizable carbonation level.

Bottle. Dark brown, almost cola-colored, pour with a medium, dense, fizzy tan head. Aroma is toasted malt, wheat, yeast, banana notes and light cocoa. Taste is banana, toasted wheat, yeast, cocoa, light caramel and light bubblegum. Light-medium bodied with a strong bubbly carbonation. Ends with more banana, toasted wheat, light cocoa and yeast notes.

500ml bottle. Chalky off-white head, fluffy. Some oddball floaties inside the caramel brown unfiltered body. Mellow doughy brown chocolate and hefe-yeast aroma. Medium bodied, really clean and drinkable for the style. Doesnt really scream fresh, would love to have this at the brewery. Solid beer nonetheless, way better than most US examples.

bottle @ Jungle Jims / Cincinnati OH --- Clear amber brown color, generous, long-lasting, two-finger beige head, blobs of lace. Aroma of malt, sugar, and banana. Taste is sweet toasted malt with mild fizz and banana with light spice that moves to a barely hopped finish. A solid, refreshing, lighter brew. Recommended.
Bottle, 500 ml from Pivoljub, Ljubljana. Pours dark brown with beige head. Banana, aroma and flavor, wheat, bit yeasty and roasty. Very nice.
Takes me back to my time in Munich. Smells sweet and sugary with a hint of malt. Deep Amber color. The flavor is equally sweet with a different after taste

Bottle at trailer. Clear brown color with lasting tan head. Clove, spicy, phenolic, banana, mild smoke aromas. Smooth medium body. Smooth banana, tangy clove, peppery flavors with light toast, mild lemon----tasty.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Poured in it shows a dark-amber colour with a nice tan head. agglomerations of yeast, i dont like that. Aromas of banana, caramel and sweet cocoa, overall rich in roasted malt . Its a chocolate liqueur-like fragrance. flavours of roasted malt and clove. fine spicy finish. medium body. soft carbonation. creamy overall.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2016 From the bottle at a hotel in Herrsching. Aroma is yeasty, bubblegum, some maltiness shining through, bananas are not so strong, but cloves. Great yeastiness in the taste and some darker malts. A bit of a roastedness that is maybe too much for my Dunkelweizen palate. Breadiness as well. Perfect silky Weizen mouthfeel. Very good, but theres Dunkelweizen I like more.

(EDIT: The first bottle of this I had did not impress me, but the next few Ive had locally were great)
First rating:
Dark black-amber color with big white head. Very dark for a Dunkelweizen. Lots of caramel, molasses. Taste is bubblegum, sweet, dark malts. Smooth mouthfeel, but really disappointing for a Dunkelweizen by Andechser...

Nice label on a 500ml europint. Chocolate Labrador retriever brown, immense and loose-knit khaki head. Flocculent sediment. Malty aroma, dominated by molasses, licorice and horehound. Sweet and seemingly thick, mossy, tannic, molasses, lightly astringent. Finishes out with burnt sugars and just a little tin. Frothy mouthfeel. Maybe a little sticky on this 90 degree Florida afternoon .   ABC Liquors, Betton.
Couleur brune, légère mousse beige. Nez malté, fruité banane, paille et note caramel. Gout leger fruité avec fortes levures et note légère caramel cuit. Corps aqueux. fin rapide levures.
Aroma of malt, lots of banana, yeast, some caramel, clove. Flavour is moderate sweet with a smooth finish. Almost no bitterness. Smooth Dunkelweizen, I really enjoyed this one.

Andechser Weissbier Dunkel has a very thick, foamy, beige head, an initially mostly clear, reddish-brown appearance, which clouds up with tan yeast chunks and billowing yeast, once the bottom contents are swished and poured in, and heavy lacing left behind. The aroma is of sweet, spicy, brown bread, and the flavor is of the same thing, with an overriding tap water aspect. Mouthfeel is medium, and Andechser Weissbier Dunkel finishes wet and rather dull. RJT

Tallahassee, Fl. - ABC Fine Wine & Spirits - 500 ml bottle. Dark brown pour, bubbly khaki colored head that clings to the edge of the glass, bug yeast chunks in the bottom dampen my enthusiasm for the appearance. Aroma has some sweet date-like accents, a touch of chocolate. Flavor is decidedly sweet with some banana notes, a hint of cloves, a touch of caramel. a raisin-like finish. Mouthfeel is very thin for the style. Expected more.
Dark brown colour with creamy white hread. Aroma of roasted barley, plums, bananas etc. The same are flavours with sweet fruity notes, low carbonation. Very good dunkel.
Bottle from Whole Foods PM. Pours turbid brown with 3-finger tan head. Nose is roasty dark malt, cacao, nuts, banana, clove. Tastes complex, like a hefe mixed with a schwarz.

Banana, graham cracker, chocolate aroma. Clear brown, not super dark, thick tan head. Caramel and graham cracker flavor, tangy lemon accents. Light body, soft carbonation. A bit lacking in richness, and a little too tangy. I wish it tasted like it smells.

2014 Philly Beer Week draft @ Bierstube. Poured hazy nut brown with a 1-finger off-white head. Aroma of banana esters, nutty malt, and a touch of yeast. Medium body, lightly fizzy, with a brief and lightly dry finish. Flavor of nutty malt with a note of caramel or toffee mixed in. A light note of biscuity yeast at the back, as well as a touch of banana esters.
(bottle 13/02-2015) large beige head, clear dark red brown color, yeast aroma, soft co2, wheat yeast taste. BB date 15.01.15.

Bottle. Yeast, overriped red fruits, spices, vanilla and caramell hints on nose. Taste. Cherries, chocolate and some coffee notes too. Dry flavor of cherries peel in aftertaste. High carbonated and very drinkable. Surprisingly, it was so tasty!
Heavy esters and caramel on the nose, rich berry notes, grapey. Hazy brown with some chunky sediment, mostly lasting off-white head. Fruity, bready. Medium bodied.

Murky brown color with white head. Lots of yeast sediments. Roasted malts, over-riped bananas, with a marked spicy and floral hints. Taste follows the aroma, with toasted malts, caramel, brown sugar, and also banana and cloves.

Chestnut brown, like the eyes of a Tolstoyan Princess, with a half-inch of cappuccino head, moderate coarseness. Aroma is caramel, moist grass, biscuit/scone, light-brown sugar, bit of rye grain. Body is medium-light, watery oily, with a medium-light carbonation of proportional burn and moderate bubble size. Flavor is grassy, slightly farmy, multigrain bread, a mere touch of caramel (rather dry compared with the aroma.) Light apple.

Lightly hazy chestnut brown body, medium to large tan head, soapy lacing. Caramel, warm bread, biscuit, toffee, banana, mellow earthy chocolate, and miscellaneous dark fruits. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation, assertive sweetness throughout, rounded, satisfying finish.
500ml bottle. Nutty brown color with thin off white head. Smell of banana, clove and malt. Some caramel malt and banana flavor. Light taste.

Pours a light brown color, topped with a decent cream colored head. Mild malty aroma, some nice notes of chocolate and caramel. Starts sweet and slightyl roasty later on, finishes with an easy bitterness and caramel notes. Not too bad, yet nothing really special.

Bottle L3013.
Glass: Weizen glass.
Appearance: Hazy chestnut body with sediment in suspension. The head is massive with great retention and a foamy and dense light tan hue.
Aroma: Bready malts mingle with hints of caramel, chocolate, underripe banana, pepper and clove. Aroma is a tad weak, but nicely balanced and complex.
Taste: Much like the aroma this is a complex and balanced beer. Bready semi-sweet intro with hints of caramel lead to a light cocoa coating over a almost ripe banana. The finish has a light clove and bubblegum presence. Very enjoyable.
Palate: Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Reminds me of soda going flat.
Overall: This is an outstanding dunkel and its available at a great price. Im very happy with this. 500ml of a world class dunkle for $3? Yes please!

Bottle from Trinkgut in Goch. The beer has dark brown, yet little hazy color and a nice cream colored head, with living carbonation. The aroma is very fruity, with clear tones of citrus and bananas. Also light tones of yeast, a light sweetness of caramel and a little cacao. The taste is full and soft. A little sour and refreshing in the beginning to change into a nice sweetness of from the caramel. The finish is a nice hoppy bitterness which is very refreshing. Well done this dunkelweizen.

Wie das helle Weißbier ist das Dunkle schön weich. Die tollen Nelken-Bananenaromen werden von einer leichten röstigen Malzigkeit ergänzt. Nicht zu trocken, schön karamellig-dunkel und sehr weich süffig.

No retention and no lacing. Smells of banana, cloves and wheat. Tastes of banana, spices and cloves. Watery aftertaste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50CL Bottle from the cave in Glasgow
Pours a dark brown with a off white head
Aroma is sweet grain with a bit of hop and sweet fruit
Taste is sweetish malt with soft fruit and a long sweetish finish
overall a good weissbeer among the best available

50cl bottle at home. Slightly hazy amber brown with a full somewhat off-white head. Light to medium body with ditto carbonation. Nice sweetness with some bitter tones. Banana, some caramel, wheat and some roasted malts. A nice German Dunkelweizen.
Draft: pours dark brown with a big foamy head, nice banana aroma, taste is malty, banana with an unfortunate watery finish. Good but no Aventinus.

Pours a finger and half of head on a cloudy light brown colored body.
The aroma is wet grain, light caramel and slight chocolate.
The taste is amazing: caramel, toasted malt, plum and a little banana. Excellent balance.
The texture is smooth and soft with a nice fizzy.

In short: A surprisingly complex and highly drinkable dunkelweizen.  Nice
How: Bottle 500ml at Die Stube, Brasov, Romania
The look: Opaque light brown body topped by a medium off-white head with medium retention
In long: Nose is like some kind of banana fudge cake, if such a thing even exists.  Taste is creamed toasted wheat, browned bananas, smooth caramel, walnuts, some fresh tobacco, pineapples, other fruits.  This dunkelweizen offers a more complex fruitiness than just the usual ripe bananas.  Full mouthfeel with a lively carbonation.  Unlike many examples of this style, this beer doesnt overdo the ripe banana flavor and the sweetness sensation is kept in check.  A very good example of a style I usually dont care for.  Some days I dont like dunkelweizens and other days I love dunkelweizens, its like I have a double personality disorder and so do I.

Clouduu brown with medium beige head. Sweet fruity aroma with yeast and wheat notes. Sweet flavour with yeasty, malt  and caramel notes.

(7/4/08) Draught at Andechser am Dom in Munich. Dark brown with a big stable beige head. Aroma of some fruity esters, clove notes and some caramelly malt. Sweet flavor with some fruity esters, toasted malt and light spiciness. Finishes a very light bitterness. Medium-bodied. A decent Dunkelweizen.

Rich and tasty beer for its strength. Bottle pours a thick dark-coffee brown with big beige head. Chocolatey, brown sugar (praline?) aroma. Mildly sweet flavor, caramel-malty with ripe banana, going into a light bitterness. Fairly thick mouthfeel, soft and nearly creamy. Nice treat.

Bottle brown, 500 ml
Appearance: Pours with medium, off - white, slightly beige head colour, it is frothy in texture and quite quickly decreasing to small in size. The lacing is smaller than the one of ’Andechser Weissbier Hefetrub’ but still exist. Body looks medium, is cloudy, opaque and brown in colour with some reddish shades. Carbonation of body is weak.
Aroma: Whipped cream, Munich malt, slightly toasty malted barley and typical for ’Andechs’ beer, flowery hops with a noticable hint of clover. Gentle banana note, some fresh juicy sweetness. Caramel, burned sugar. All in all aroma is more intensive than in ’Andechser Weissbier Hefetrub’ especially due to smaller head but in fact it is one of the most interesting aroma of Dunkel Weizen style of beer I’ve had so far.
Flavour: Front is mild and salty on tongue, carbonation on palateis salty and quite lively what creates very impressive profile. There are pronounced notes of toastyness and later on roastyness on palate. Finish duration is medium to long.
Palate: Body is medium, texture is smooth, between wattery to creamy, carbonation on palate is quite lively. Finish feel is a bit chalky and slightly accidic.

Bottle. Very malty and fruity, banana. Moderate creamy off-white head, normal long lasting; very dark red body. Moderate sweet, light acidic, rather short duration. Light to medium body, light dry texture, soft carbonation.

Bottle. High creamy and lasting off-white head. Hazy dark brown body. Smoky aroma. Carbonated flavor of roasted and smoked malt, fruity notes in the background, some bitterness as well. Long bitter sweet aftertaste.

Andechser am Dom, Munich. Aroma chocolate, nuts, banana, clove. Prickling with carbonation and wrapped in lace. No frills dunkelweizen without ornamentation. Subtly peppery and dry. Clovey and woodsy, but restrained. Light banana fruit, of course. Solid.

Hazy, dark brown with a nice head. The aroma has notes of clove, wheat and banana. The flavour is full-bodied considering this is a dunkel weiss. It has notes of clove, caramel, wheat, banana and its really, really nice.
Hazy brown with a small off-white head. Toffee malty aroma with only a weak note of banana and clove. Dry malty flavour with some yeast character.

Århus2008. 50 cL bottle. Pours dark brown to orange with a hazy look and a dense slight off-white head. Light spiced and wheaty aroma. Flavour is medium dry wheaty with a light acidic touch and mild wheaty note. Ends mild acidic and medium spiced.
Pours a cloudy brown with a large tan head. Aroma of wheat and banana. Feels nice on the tounge. Very good.

Rating No.2000
Bottled(500ml). -Pours a cloudy dark brown colour with big beige head and wheaty acidic nose. Lively carbonation. The aroma is typical weizen, very wheaty, fruity and yeasty with notes of cinnamon and strong banana  flavor. Also light spicy, milk chocolate and roasted notes. Very good milestone brew.
The bottle looks good, the beer in the glass also. Tastes too malty and too frutiy, too much like plum. Only an average hefeweizen.

Bottle 50cl. Pours rather dark, thick white head. Tastes of dark roasted malt, coffee. Fizzy carbonation, refreshing. Yeast taste too much in the background in my opinion. A good Dunkelweizen but there are much better beers from this brewery.
Bottle. Thanks to bierkoning! Pours a muddy dark brown with a fizzy medium head. Aroma of banana and chocolate. Taste is more of the same, with coffee sneaking in at the end.
Nose of wheat, banana, malt and toffee. Pours a lovely caramel colour beer with a lofty head. Taste is a flurry of wheat, malt and hops. A bitter sweet finish make this a throughly enjoyable beer.

Body starts fairly full and well-carbonated with some dark caramel malty sweetness and a hint of clove spice.  Well-balanced and drinkable.

Fantastic dunkel malt and banana ester aroma,probaly the best in this style I ve ever experienced ,like a banana under your nose while your in a chocolate bakery, taste is initial banana and rich dark German Malts,but the palate quickly diminishes to a sharp thin wheat taste,and finishes almost watery. Stupendously huge beige head, slowly collapsing over totally opaque brown beer. Very creamy nose, with bananaester, but also milk chocolate, and wheat - slightly sourish-smelling. Dark, and dry malts, slight acidity (again typically wheadt), and fruity (near citrus). Finish is again creamy-fruity, and milk chocolate. Retronasal a touch of hops. Wheat slickness, medium bodied. Quality Weisse.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2009 Draft from Andescher am Dom. Dark brown, chocolate color, cloudy, dense with big thick stable head. Clean, sweet hefe and banana ester aromas. Not at all sticky. The beer is a bit on the thin side but its very drinkable. Nice sweetness that never becomes cloying.
Dark brown with a wonderfull white head. Bread, caramel, banana, nuts, wheat & yeast. Medium bodied with a lively carbonation.  Light sweetness. Very fresh & drinkable Dunkelweizen!

500ml bottle: the store I shop at finally got this in as part of a six pack with the Hefetrub weizen. Poured dark brown with a large fluffy tan head. Medium banana and spice aroma with a little roasted malt. Flavor is not quite as big as the aroma with some banana, some chocolate, dark fruits. Very nice beer that drinks easy.
Bottled. Dark amber colour, mediumsized beige creamy head, long lasting and lacing. Aroma is spices, malts, fruits and some wheat. Flavour i wheat, raisins, yeast, dark fruits and some sweet malts.

500ml bottle at the Priory Arms, Stockwell. Pours a very dark brown with a big white lacy head. Looks fantastic in the glass and gives off a bewitching aroma of liquorice, malt and fruit. The flavour is caramel roasted malts with the aforementioned fruit getting a look in. The mouthfeel is smooth and not cloying and the finish is nicely flavoursome. Overall, good stuff.

Courtesy boboski.  Cloudy, very dark brown color with a 1 cm thick light tan head.  Very light clove aroma, a hint of pepper, but a good deal less aroma than the Weiss.  The taste displays a lot more clove character than the aroma.  The finish was dry and the spice character complimented the dryness nicely.

Peanut butter highlights accentuate a mud-brown body, opaque and clouded. A large light beige head falls slowly back to where it originated, rocky along the way and leaving behind gorgeous lacing. the color of the body is truly ugly but looks like melted candy, so thats a definite plus. Peppery caramel malt shows up first in the aroma, followed by big clove notes, light unripened banana, traces of smoke and anise and a dollop of pulpy orange. Large clusters of toasty grains round out the aroma. The flavor is really mostly uninteresting to me. Light bitterness, low acidity, medium sweetness. The mouthfeel is soft, not as grainy as a typical weizenbock, well balanced. Finishes with caramel, banana and large clove punches.

Pours a cloudy dark maroon with a thick light tan head.  Smells of light malts, some wheat, a little caramel, and some dark fruit.  All on the more mild side.  Smells a little sweet.  Get some banana which is typical for this style, sugary sweet malts and caramel make their presence known as well.  This is balanced pretty good between the dunkel and the weizen.  I defintitely got some wheat characters, which havent been as noticeable in others of this style I have previously tried.  That was refreshing.  Aftertaste was sweet on the lips, nice caramel and brown sugar.  Another solid effort from these ballin ass nuns!
Bottle at home ... Deep brown ... Slightly smokey  bubblegum nose ... mostly wheat bubblegumm and banana ... little caramel. Oddly a very typical wheat in all but colour.
Bottle at Københavnske øldage 07. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma is wheat, citrus, caramel. Flavour is wheat, caramel, orange, citrus. Nice beer.
Bottle 0,5l at the Market, Olympiapark München 18 Jun 07. Dark brown coloured. A small white head. Fruity aroma. Very carbonated. Unvaried flavor and aftertaste of oranges and banana..

Bottle at Københavnske Øldage. Murky brown beer with a dense, beige head. Nice aroma with banana, spices, cloves and caramel. The flavor on the other hand, is too dominated by caramel-sweetness, but theres also some cloves. Too thin and carbonated, and caramel and hops in the finish. Lovely start, boring flavor and finish. (070512)

500ml bottle sampled with Finn. Very dark brown body under a off-white head. Aroma of wheat malt. Rounded taste of apples, banana and spicies. Rather lively carbonated. Moderate to full palate (Olympiapark, München 18.06.2007).
Got this beer from a friend.  Nice dark brown color with a sweet aroma.  Slight bitter taste but not overpowering.  A good slow drinking beer.
Nose is banana & brown sugar.  Flavor is kinda of simple.  Caramel is rich but not overpowering.

Brun ufiltreret øl, som sikkert var blevet for gammel da jeg smage den. Gæren var bundfaldet, og smagte for tydeligt igennem. Kraftig malt duft. Den brændte tykke smag som jeg forventede var blevet flad og kedelig.

Bottle. Pours a great dark nutty brown with a small, staying head that laces a little. Aroma has loads of caramel, some banana coming through. Flavour is a touch sour to begin with, then turns towards a nice chocolate center - there is some spicyness in there as well. It begins a little thin, then turns much fuller as the chocolate and roasted edge comes to the fore.

Bottle.
Cloudy orange brown coloured with an off white head.
Sweet aroma of caramel, spices and bananas.
Flavour of spices, caramel and bananas.
A Sim rate (Bottle at Reading Beer Festival): Chocolate dunkel aroma with caramel and malt. Tastes sweetly bitter with malt and malt and malt...
Bottle. Dark amber colour with a large, off-white and rocky head. Standard wheat beer aromas of cloves and yeast.  Easy drinking with sweet flavours of ripe bananas and toffee. Pretty good.

[bottle]
Nice banana-clove-malt, with a little hops, in the nose, livened up by tingly carbonation.  Opaque cloudy brown with clots of yeast/trub on the bottom (was that my fault in pouring or the brewers in his yeast selection?).  Excellent flavour of well-balanced phenolics and esters with not so much residual sweetness as other beers of this stye, making it quite refreshing.  No detectible bitterness, but the flavour seems to be "stable" in some manner.  Perhaps a touch of chocolate/caramel.  The medium to high carbonation also aids in the refreshing nature of this beer.  Medium to light body.  I see no flaws in this beer.
Yeasty nose, not much esters there (maybe too cold?). Quite an easy one, wheat and bananas but not too sweet.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2007 Bottled. A cloudy dark brown beer, with a big and persistent light brown head. Typical aroma of wheat, yeast, with cloves . Sweet malty flavours with only a light bitterness. Theres wheat and banana. Soft mouthfeel, medium body. Satisfacting and quite filling; one of the better examples of dunkelweizen.

Bottle. Head was average, frothy and off-white which mostly diminished. Body was slightly hazy and some light cloudy particles were to be found. Colour was amber to brown. Aroma was caramel, grain, coriander, flowers, and light notes of banana. Light bodied with a thin texture and a soft carbonation. Light sweet with a metallic finish.
Bottle: Poured a black brown in color with a thin tan head. Sweet malt aroma. Rich sweet malt flavor. Not average but not outstanding either.

Bottle. Brown with  a frothy off-white mostly lasting head. Moderate aroma of malt, some slightly roasted caramel, yeasty. Flavor has a medium sweetness, caramel, good medium roasty maltiness and wheat, some hoppiness. Bit sweet and bitter finish. Tasty Dunkel wheat.

Bottle. Hazy medium amber color with a larhe good lacing light brown head. Aroma is gum, moderate hoppy and yeasty. flavor is moderate sweet and light bitter woth a average duration. Body is lifht, texture is watery, carbonation is soft.

500ml bottle from Bacchanalia, Cambridge.  Cloudy dark brown colour with lasting beige head.  Great tasting wheat beer.  Slightly sweet, cereal flavour.  Some toffee, some choc/coffee.  Tasty.  Good filling satisfying beer.  Some banana, nice lemon freshness.  Mostly cereal throughout.
Bottle.  Poured a hazy dark brown with nice frothy head.  Sweet mallty aroma with malty, yeasty flavor with hints of chocolate and caramel.  Nice!!!!
Dark brown, unclear. Lots of off-white head, but not lasting. Has a sweet aroma, lots of coriander too. Nice, dark palate. Perhaps notes of cerial in the aroma.
As usually, I prefer the dunkelweizen to its lighter hefeweizen counterpart.  Perhaps its the fuller, toastier flavor.

Bottle. Murky brown with a beautiful light brown and mostly lasting head. Malt, flovers and smokey wheat in the aroma. More wheat and some yeast in the well balanced flavor. The little sweetness in the flavor is followed up by a primarily bitter average finish. A well balanced weissbier.

Bottle. Dark reddish colour with a longlasting off-white head. Sweet malty, wheaty aroma with some hints of yeast. Sweet malty yeasty flavor with hints of caramel. Sweet malty finish with some wheaty yeast hints and some bitterness in the aftertaste.

Bottle at Monks Café, Stockholm. dark brown with a rich beige foam. Spicy aroma of toasted malts, toffee and banana. Flavour of toasted bread, spices and banana in flavour with undertones of dark chocolate. Dry finish of toasted malts, over-riped dark fruit and banana.

A nice score from Germany, thanks DerDoppelbock! Poured a murky muddy brown color (much cloudier and just flat out brown than any dunkeweizen Ive ever had) with a decent initial head, decent retention, ok lacing. The aroma was bananas, light toasted/roasted notes, some spicing. The flavor was tilted towards the spices, which was really quite nice. Keeping the tingle of the spices at the front, avoiding banana ester overload, and also ducking the overly roasted character of some run of the mill dunkelweizens gets this a few extra points in my book. Yeast was pretty tasty, although man, this beer was muddy murky brown, like pond water or something. Mouthfeel was smooth, full, yet not overly dry like some dunkelweizens. A well done, distinctive dunkelweizen.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2009 (Draught at GBBF, London, 3 Aug) Colour is dark brown, muddy, with beige frothy head.  Nose has a roasted/burnt character of wheat, banana and milk chocolate. Taste is slightly acidic, with a roasted wheat character, banana and chocolate. Well balanced and fairly dry. Nice taste of banana/chocolate flavoured ice-cream. 7/3/7/4/14=3.5 Rerate: (Bottle, 5 May 2009) Dark brown colour with lasting, frothy, beige head. Hazy. Fruity, malty nose with notes of chocolate, nougat, herbs, banana and spicy hints of clove and coriander. Malty, roasted taste with chocolate, toffee, hazel nuts, banana and a fairly short finish with hints of yeast, clove and coriander. Below medium body, smooth and creamy body. Fairly dry and well balanced. Not exceptional, but nice and tasty.

Dark amber coloured, quite stable fluffy off-white head; fruity-sourish (grapes, bananas, cloves) nose with traces of dark malt; light sweetish (malty) flavour with a little sourness; sweet-malty, slightly sourish and fruity finish, light to medium bodied. A good, average Dunkelweizen...........

Unclear brown body, beige head, laces; Huge nose with lots of banana, yeast, white bread dough and warmer malty notes as well as brown sugar; Huge soft sparkle in well balanced body; Finishing quite long with a little fitting fresh bitterness to stand up to the warmer malty notes.

Draught at Andechs monastery, nr Munich. Very tasty Dunkelweizen, with some sweet choc, fizziness and yeasty, cloudy, fruitiness. Refreshing - especially after that painful climb to the venue, post last nights hangover...

Bottle. Copper-brown with a tannish coloured head. The aroma is sweet, fruity, notes of banana, and yeast. Soft yeasty palate with that banana shining through again. Sampled at the Københavnske Øldage 2006 on May 20, 2006.

Poopie brown, very creamy dusty thick head. Creamy aroma, light malty chocolate, dirty german water, banana, dry soda crackers. Pretty nice. 
Flavor is a little iffy. Watery soda crackers, lightly roasted stale malts, minerally water. Okay and drinkable, but could be more interesting like the doppelbock.
Woody brown, creamy tan head. Slightly sour dough, yeasty nose. Medium body, smooth with late yeasty wheat character. Clean dark wheat.

.5L bottle.  Lightly hazy brown dark brown body, thin foamy white head.  Dried banana, yeast, dark chocolate frosting in the aroma.   The flavor starts out with apple skin fruity malt and yeast, then carries to woody, bready malt.  Finishes with some banana and sweet bread.  A damn good dunkelweizen, I like the combination of fruity esters and light chocolate.

Thanks Dave.  Best before 080806.  The beer pours to a very murky brown body with a creamy tan head.  The aroma is very estery with tons of bananas, some caramel, toasty malts, interesting yeasts.  The flavor is toasty caramel, banana sorbet, interesting yeasts.  Very unique and extremely drinkable.  The palate is smooth, easy drinking, lightly fruity.

dark brown w/ some visable carbonation and a thick fluffy off white head w/ some thick lacing.  Roast grains and bannanas dominate the aroma with a light carmel note.  Palate is well carbonated ok body bordering on thin.  Flavor is very full of roasted wheat and some notes of bannanna and yeast but seems just to plain.  Very drinkable, but not really something Ill remember tomorrow.
Bottle. Weak, roasted aroma. Very dark brown colour. Big, stable light brown head. Nice flavour with a nice roastiness, not estery. Very nice for the style.

Bottled.  Opaque dark brown (barely ruby under light) with a brief light brown head.  Smells of dark roasted malts (toffee) with lots of banana, wheat, and yeast.  Similar taste but subdued in strength.  Thin.  Pleasant, but not very assertive, smooth and pleasant, but not  memorable.  Im somewhat disappointed - this is from Andechs, after all!

Bottle. Creamy white excellent mostly lasting head. Wonderfull dark amber colour. Powerfull yeasty aroma. A little less powerfull flavor. Average finish. Lively! carbonated. There are better german hefe.

On tap at The Andechs Klostergasthof.  Cloudy, rusty chocolate brown in color with a creamy tan head that later on hosts a head retention clinic.  Perfect aroma, hands down.  Chocolate covered ripe-fried bananas, surrounded by cloves and pepper, which entertain some mocha bean grinds.  Quite the refreshing take on a flavorful bounty.  Ginger accents are overlayed with chocolate powder, and then the combination of the two are sprinkled on bananas.  Cloves and pepper happily continue with some background white chocolate for complexity.  Modest carbonation and refreshingly light bodied.  Banana crème with a muted chocolate flavors bring things to a close, semi-subconsciously accented by a minor dose of cleansing lemon.
As good as the doppel?  No.  But still a damn fine beer with nice foundations of malt and a hint of maple.  Fantastic dark wheat.
Bottle. Brown colour with a huge light brown mostly lasting head. Taste of fruits, herbs and malts.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2009 1. Bottle at the GBBF, Kensington Olympia 06/08/2003
Mid brown coloured with some pale and sour fruit aromas. Slightly dry lasting finish.
2. Cask Stillage at the GBBF, Earls Court 06/08/2009
Slightly smoked aroma. Dark coloured and hazy in appearance with some alcohol present. A little dryness in a malt finish.
Wow!, the best Dunkel Hefe Weizen I have tried ever, it had a realy deliscious flavor and aroma, the appearance was great. Many Dunkel Hefe Weizen has no flavor at all, and if any, its different.
50 cl bottle. Yeast at the bottom. Dark brown colour with a nice large head. Nice aroma of bread, roasted malt, chocolate and some sweetness too. Light dry flavour of roastedness and wheat.
500ml Bottle. Murky brown. Yeasty, wheaty and banana aroma. Sweet toffee, creamy, banana and cloves, wheaty and refreshing. A good example of the style.

Bon Accord. I found this accidently in an attempt to show my brother a dunkel. All i can say is im glad he asked. Aroma of wheat with complex smokey, maltiness, and a great sweetness also. Taste is very similar with the sweetnbess of the malt and the carbonation mixing to creat an amazin beer, one of the best iv had for quite a while. Will be going back for more soon.
(Bottle 50 cl) Muddy brown with a dense and solid head. Soft and very malty with a good balance between its sweetness and a small, discreet bitterness. Very pleasant and highly drinkable. 270402

A hazy Cola colored beer with a foamy tan head. Great Banana and Clove nose that reminds me of Aventinus. A malty Hefeweizen, Banana and Cloves with some slightly burned whole wheat toast, candi sugar middle with a slight tartness in the finish. Very tasty!

Bottled. Aroma of banana with a hint of chocolat. Cloudy, dark brown color, beige head, good lace. Light sweet, banana, also chocolat in the flavor, soft. Not exceptional but a very nice dunkelweizen.
Cloudy brown color, big off-white head. Aroma of wheat, banana, caramel malt. Full taste of malt, some chocolate and banana, spicy. Good dunkelweizen.

500 ml bottle, bought in Germany. ABV is 5.0%. Cloudy dark brown colour, enormous thick and creamy light tan head. Lovely aroma of brown bread, yeast, cloves, banana and caramel. Flavour has malts, caramel, chocolate and cloves, some hops in the fairly dry finish. I had it on its own, must be good with food too. A very fine dunkelweizen.

(bottle) Dark and cloudy brown body with a thick foamy off-white head. Soft sweet malty nose with dried fruits (raisins) and cloves. Very smooth toastmalty taste with caramel and yeasts, gentle and lasting clove spicy finish with a distinctive bitterness. One of the best of this style I had so far.

Aroma of bananas, wheats and malts. Some nutty notes or spices make it quite pleasant. Cloudy, brown coloured with a lasting, medium,  brownish head. Taste is sweet, fruity (bananas), wheaty, bit yeasty and quite malty. Fresh and a bit dry. Well balanced. Perfect dunkelweizen.

From A Bottle.Dark auburn in colour with a large head,aroma is of wheat and malt,
taste is wheat,banana,yeast and malt.

Dark brown with red tints and an off-white head of foam.  Aromas are malty like a chocolate milkshake.  Also has yeast and banana.  Flavours are sweet and malty, chocolate smooth with banana, yeast and spices.  Very moreish.  A good Dunkle Weisse.

Thanks to Madsberg for sending this one!
This starts out nicely with a substantial thick off-white head that does what a good Dunkelweizen head should do.
Yeasty, slightly sour aroma that has some nuttiness.
Ruddy brown in color with a typical wheat haze to it.
Smooth palate delivers a very pleasing sweetness that carries a bit of tartness in the finish. Well done and Im sure would be worth a try fresh on the other side of the big water where it would be even better than the one I have here.

This dunkelweizen is a standard example of the style.  Deep amber brown with a great lasting cloudy and creamy head.  Aroma is fruity with some banana and ripe apple character balanced with clove and sweet munich and a hint of nuttiness.  Flavor is sweet but not cloying- slightly tart in the finish but overall a very drinkkable smooth beer.

Tawny colour, with a ruby tinge. Modest, but lasting, beige head. Low, but persistent carbonation. If theres supposed to be a yeast sediment, its not much in evidence. Creamy wheat aroma, with a touch of spice and vanilla. Not much sign of banana, or malt. Fresh and clean on the palate. Creamy vanilla again in the flavour. Theres something a bit dark, maybe chocolate, and vaguely smoky, but not exactly malty. Starts sweet but finishes with some acidity. Compromised by a slight metallic tang in the aftertaste. Mouthfeel is a touch thin. Perfectly serviceable, but not a standout. 500ml bottle, from beersofeurope.co.uk. My bottle was 5.0% by the way.
The ubiquitous Dunkelweizen. Excellent, with a full body and flavour. The best Dunkelweizen Ive had.

One of the most beautiful beers I´ve seen. Thick, cloudy red/brown colour. Huge foamy head. Caramelly, coffee, cloves aroma.  Caramelly, yeasty, malty, slightly spicy taste. Smooth mouthfeel. One of the better Dunkelweizens.
Hazy dar reddish colour with large frothy head. Aroma is sweet and malty with hints of caramel. Flavor has a light sweetness with hints of caramel and some spices. Nice smooth palate.

UPDATED: JUN 29, 2014 Bottle. Head is initially large, frothy, light brown, mostly lasting. Body is hazy dark brown, bottle conditioned. Aroma is moderately malty (bread, cookie, caramel, cocoa powder), lightly yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of banana, clove, and brown sugar. Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly bitter. Finish lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, watery texture, lively carbonation. 10 years later and Im finally able to sample this again. And along with the Helles version, the Weissbiers are the most consistently enjoyable things this brewery makes.
Bottle. Unclear brown with nice head. Wheaty, cloves, crisp toasted maltiness, caramel, nice mouthfeel. A good one.

Bottled
Nut brown, almost opaque. Good tanned head. Crisp citron aroma (no trace of wheat found here). Crisp, a bit smokey, but also sweet banana flavor + wheat. Good bodied and well-balanced weizen.

Dark, almost black cloudy color. Little beige head.Yeasty and phenol aroma with notes of banana, pretty standard for dunkelweizens. Strong carbonation, medium bodied with soft mouthfeel. Mild banana flavor, yeasty ending with piles of yeast at the bottom of the glass. Expected more out of this, after having great doppelbock-dunkel from this same brewery.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Fairly foamy, light brown head with a very dark, almost black, hazy brown body. Very nice, I like this a lot. Flavors are malty, banana-ish and some hops. Nice, pretty highly carbonated mouthfeel. Very good Dunkles Weissbier.
tangy taste which quickly turns to a nice dull but extravagent fruit. woodish tan head and light bubbles which cascaded from the bottom of the glass.
Hazy brown color, light yasty aroma and roasted taste, medium body, fresh finish.

gradient color of yellow to murky brown.  small head. aroma of walnuts and wood.  carbonated body with slight froth and med mouthfeel.  flavor is slightly sour & woody with a litte hint of fruit.  strawberries? sampled on tap at andecsher am dom in munchen.

On tap at Andechser am Dom in Munich. Hazy yeasty dark brown appearance with a huge frothy head. Delicious malty, yeasty aroma. Amazing malty, yeasty flavor, with tones of chocolate, hints of carmel, fig, and bannana. Similar to Schneider but more flavorfull, rich and complex.

Bottled. DBF 2004. 
Hazy brown. Roasted flavour with bubble-gum notes. Short finish.

Bottled at DBF 2004.
A rather yeasty, cereal aroma.
Lively and fresh with a yeasty flavour.

(Bottled) Hazy dark brown color with a large, off-white head. Mild, yeasty and slightly sweet aroma. Quite mild and sweetish, slightly burned-malty flavor - easily drinkable. Medium-bodied, bitter and reasonably carbonated palate. Quite pleasant, but only average as a dunkelweizen.

Bottled.  Aroma had some smokiness in there which I don't think should have been present.  The colour is almost black with a small white head and no lacing.  The taste is typically weizen (bananas) but the beer is disappointing thin and watery.  Hoped for better.

An unclear brown beer with a fine beige head. The aroma is characteristic of a German wheat beer; wheaty and yeasty. The flavor is sweet and malty with notes of caramel. An OK beer, but nothing special for the type of dunkles German hefeweizen - I've had them better.
Quite roasted aroma and flavor. Strong wheat and yeast in both flavor and palate. Aftertaste unpleasantly wheaty.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2003 Tall and creamy light brown head with a very dark hazy brown body! Beautiful!! Flavors are coffee, liquorice and some hops. Watery aftertaste. Quite high on CO2. Pretty good Dunkel Weiss.
Darkish brown hazy color. The taste i malts, and a little bit of spices. Nothing special about this beer.
Beautiful dark brown colour. Nice malty aroma with hints of banana and toffee. Very good flavour with a nice malt presence. Soft spicy finish.
Brown color, generous head. Malt nose, yeast, typical Weißbier aroma. Dry mouthfeel, just poor Weißbier.

Bottled at the Danish Beerfestival 2003: Dark amber coloured. Medium head. Slightly roasted in the nose. Light spiced. Sweet flavour with caramel notes. Smooth. Pleasant bitterness and crispy in the end.

Bread and clove nose.
Murky brown, head could be larger.
Bread and slight banana tastenotes.
Lightbodied - not Andechs' best.

Frothy brown/black beer with an oatmealy and lightly smoked aroma.  The flavour features cloves, slight coffeeness and broad alcohol elements.  Overall a pleasant refreshing drink like so many of the German Dunkels.
Amazing color for a weissbier, almost black. Bananaaroma with caramel. Sweetish taste with cappucino, toffee, banana and malt flavors. Amazingly good dunkel weizen!!
full burnst vanilla aroma. looks very inviting. has a bit more oomph than your usual dunkles hefe and a good balance of sweetness and saltiness

Wheaty nose, not too strong, but pleasant. Cloudy dark brown color and a good head. Heavy malt and wheat combo, slight hint of coffee too. Good balance and a quality beer for sure. I wasnt overwhelmed like with other Andechs beers. I like the Paulaner Dunkles Hefeweizen better (see my rating).
Sweet malty aroma with hints of chocolate. Dark brown body with orange highlights and a little head. Yeasty with honey flavor. Fullmouth and crisp.
Cloudy pale nut brown. Very lively. Big banan esteryness. Nice toffe flavour. Light bodied, but still with good malt presence. Thirst quenching.
A nice dunkle weiss with a smooth fruity and chocolatey flavour, a slight sweetness (not too much, which is good), and a soft finish.

UPDATED: JUL 19, 2009 Densely sedimented chestnut colour with a nice head.  Banana nose with light wheat and milk chocolate.  Full, sweet body with a good balance of banana and chocolate.  Only a hint of wheat in the finish, but enough to cut the sugars.  A relatively moreish example of this underperforming beer style.
